author: Nelz Graves

text: It's weird. In most video games, i always have the feeling that i know i'll win, i know i'll save the world, because i'm the good guy and that's what i have to do. But this game sort of hit me differently. Throughout the whole thing, there's this whole theme that no matter what you do, the moon's always gonna crash in the end. You can't save anyone, you can only rewind time and start over again. It's just so hopeless, and i really wasn't used to video games doing that before i played this.

author: Raiigen

text:
It's actually amazing how many important life lessons games like Zelda taught us. Look forward and fight, even if everything seems hopeless. Never give up, there will always be a new dawn. Someone will always be waiting for you. No matter how small you are, you can still be a hero. Link gives me courage every day of my life. When I'm feeling down, he always appears in my mind, cheering me up. Nerdy? Maybe, but it still works.
Hope you found a better job and everything is a lot better now! Cheers
author: Raiigen

author: Garo

text:
When I listen to this, I find my body goes very still and I begin to get a shiver that runs from the top of my head right down to the tips of my toes.

I always found this piece of music very moving and would always get Link to run the entire way from where ever he was to the clock tower. As I got closer clambering to reach the top of the clock tower, bells would ring and the earth shook violently. And when I reached the top, I would stare into the gaping abyss. Damn, this game was atmospheric!

author: Rodrigo Cavalcanti

text: @godverdegodverdomme I've played all 3, and OoT was better than both. LttP gave a loose story of an evil wizard getting the Triforce and warping the land to reflect his heart, but OoT made the overall experience much more immersive and enjoyable. It took the series in a new and fantastic direction while keeping true to the core feel of the series. MM had a good idea, but I hated it for stylistic reasons (that damn idiot moon) and the sheer uselessness of 80% of your masks.
author: Azsalyn

text: I would have hated MM a lot less if the moon didn't look so goddamn retarded. I like the idea of time traveling back over and over to try to defy fate, but it was so hard to take seriously with that idiotic face in front of me so much of the time.
author: Azsalyn

text: @masterplusmargarita I think MM is overrated.
author: GanonAkumaFan

text:
@godverdegodverdomme WW IS better than ALttP. Better music, better storyline, arguably more well-designed dungeons (Tower of Gods, Earth and Wind Temple are really master pieces when it comes to dungeon gameplay)
However (to me, anyway), ALttP is a close second to my favorite Zelda. The reason for this is because the lack of dungeons and the tedious Triforce Fetch Quest dragged down the appeal of WW quite a bit.

text: Majora's mask's sense of impending doom was a very well done. The atmosphere was great, even for a N64 game. I played it as an 8 year old, and even I got filled with a sense of dread as the last day approached. It's ridiculous how well they did for a video game aimed at younger audiences. They made every detail for the atmosphere good. Townspeople, slight changes in music, etc.

author: johannhowitzer

text: @synthetikcheese For me, Majora's Mask was the best Zelda game.  People didn't like it because of the time mechanic, but that's exactly why I liked it.  It may have only had four dungeons, but those four were incredible, and when you add all the events you have to manipulate outside the dungeons to make stories end happily, you have a masterwork.  OoT was "canon"... whatever.  It can't touch MM.

author: micLuc14

text:
Oh as i sit and think with my bow this night, 
how i must overcome this terrible plight, 
the feelings that i have right now are stirred,
 the visions in my mind of friends so blurred,
dekus, gorons, zoras all alike,
i have helped them in their time of fright,
now ready i am with masks so true,
the feelings of many flow right through,
the moon is falling now it seems,
drawing near to my time of dreams,
fight him i know i must do, 
but after as ill leave, know that i will miss you

author: saurfan

text:
Imagine walking through the lively town on the first day. People are laughing & dancing, peace reigns supreme. You happen to realize you just walked past a box you could've broken. So casually you turn around.
As you do the music fades quickly along with your turn & stops.
Everything except for you is in black & white and the town is empty, dead silent.
Everything is like this. You head to the Clock Tower, the arm comes down & the tower opens.
Skull Kid laughs. This plays.
Good atmosphere?

author: ssj3sora

text: @ManfredMitchum As someone else that listens to black metal, I find this sort of hilarious, but also sort of fitting. Agreed.
author: Akerfeldtfan

text: Ahhh this is a good one. There should be more songs from this game, it had a great soundtrack. This song scared the shit out of me when I was young, to be honest. Talking to everyone, seeing them scared about the apocalypse that was unavoidably coming...really brought you into the world and the despair that was felt by everyone. Unlike most people, THIS is my favorite zelda game- it had the best characters and atmosphere to me, and it was so very dark!
author: Akerfeldtfan

text:
Well supra saying one of the 3d zeldas is your *least favorite* is kind of like saying which super expensive luxury car is your least favorite when majoras mask, OOT, and twilight were all ridiculously excellent. 

Besides whether its the best game or the worst game ,you gotta admit,  majoras mask was by far the creepiest zelda game.
author: elfred1980

text: This is one of my absolute favorites from this game. It really does give you a feeling of the world coming to an end.
author: PAVGN

text: @nessx007 no can u send me a link?
author: Joshua Martinez

text: Thank you so much, SupraDarky, for finally adding this. This song, Oath to Order, Song of Healing, as well as the song that plays in the beginning in the woods when Link is on Epona mean so much to me in terms of video game music and sentimental value. One of the reasons I listen to black metal is because it allows me to evoke my deepest emotions when I need to the most, and to me this is almost the video game music equivalent to black metal. Words cannot describe how much I love this game.
author: ManfredMitchum

author: Bryanneo1

text: Alright, time for the list to keep going! I've always loved this theme, very ominous. I've always said this is actually my least favorite 3D Zelda, and I know some of you guys think it's actually the best one, but I have to point out that it's still a great game. I especially liked what they did with the town and the general atmosphere.
author: SupraDarky
